revision.text:
{{ArticleHistory | action1=PR | action1date=23:11, 28 July 2015 (UTC) | action1link=Wikipedia:Peer review/76th Infantry Division (United Kingdom)/archive1 | action1result=reviewed | action1oldid=673546834 | action2 = GAN | action2date = 13:59, 9 September 2015 (UTC) | action2link = Talk:76th Infantry Division (United Kingdom)/GA1 | action2result = listed | action2oldid = 680221650 | currentstatus = GA | topic = Warfare |action3=WAR |action3date=07:06, 20 November 2015 (UTC) |action3link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/76th Infantry Division (United Kingdom) |action3result=approved |action3oldid=689880179 }} {{WPMILHIST |class = GA |A-Class=pass |British-task-force=yes |WWII-task-force=yes}} ==Division Patch== I've come across this before (80th division page) where a photo of the patch is replaced with a drawing of one. This was described as policy.
1) Where can I find this policy?
2) Why the preference for a representation one more stage removed from reality (usually accurate, though the 59th Div's is wrongly proportioned) over a photo of an original article?
If it's real and reasonable, I'll shut up. [[User:Usedtoknowthat|Usedtoknowthat]] ([[User talk:Usedtoknowthat|talk]]) 21:03, 9 May 2015 (UTC) :I would like to note that practically every divisional insignia O have seen, for various nations across the wiki, are SVG files based off actual works. As for policy: per [[Wikipedia:Image use policy]], generally "Drawings, icons, logos, maps, flags and other such images are preferably uploaded in SVG format as vector images."[[User:EnigmaMcmxc|EnigmaMcmxc]] ([[User talk:EnigmaMcmxc|talk]]) 23:05, 9 May 2015 (UTC) == GA == Nicely done Enigma; thanks for the opportunity to work "bogus" into the article too. ;O))[[User:Keith-264|Keith-264]] ([[User talk:Keith-264|talk]]) 09:35, 24 December 2015 (UTC) :Thank you, and your welcome! [[User:EnigmaMcmxc|EnigmaMcmxc]] ([[User talk:EnigmaMcmxc|talk]]) 13:23, 24 December 2015 (UTC)
